intro: Rondeletia rugelii, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are adapted for pollination by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
